blog.name: pyrot3ch-nick
blog.title: Engineering Fireworks
blog.description:
I'm Nick. I also go by Nico.
Currently DMing worlds where newsies have heroic arcane powers and where the gods walk among us.
I'm bi, latino, and studying mechs

body:
Grim Realization

Spoilers for Critical Role Campaign 2, Episode 42.

TL;DR: Avantika or Vera might have counterspell/dispel magic prepared against Caleb’s Wall of Fire.

Avantika is a spell caster to an extent. Theories are that

  • Most likely, she’s a full warlock like Fjord, though probably a different aspect of Ukatoa like Great Old One or Celestial even, and she chose Tome Pact or Blade pact since she had a book/journal that sounds like a spellbook and she has magical dagger.
  • a Profane Soul Blood Hunter which is the caster subclass of the Blood Hunter and can utilize limited Warlock spellcasting
  • an Eldritch Knight Fighter
  • or and least likely an Arcane Trickster Rogue or a Bard.

Counterspell and dispel are available to those classes at varying levels at least according to PC creation rules. I state that because NPCs are crafted differently than PCs to ensure gameplay balance.

And Vera, well she’s able to cast locate object on the book so she might have some magical abilities. We don’t know a lot about Vera so her class theorizing is much broader than Avantika’s.

  • She might be a wizard or sorcerer. Though we don’t know her arcane tradition or sorcerous origins. I’m leaning toward Abjuration or Divination wizard since she seems to be protective of Avantika but her recent statements seem like there’s something not quite there any more.
  • maybe an arcane or blood cleric who’s deity is Ukatoa or Avantika herself. If she is an arcana cleric, she would have access to counterspell.
  • Heck she might be a old Paladin since the spell Locate Object is part of the Paladin’s spell list.

And guess what? Dispel magic is a spell available to Paladins as well.

This just makes me worry more for the upcoming fight.

And I love it and I live to see the fight unfold how it may.

Spoilers for Critical Role Campaign 2, Episode 42.

TL;DR: Avantika or Vera might have counterspell/dispel magic prepared against Caleb’s Wall of Fire.

Avantika is a spell caster to an extent. Theories are that

  • Most likely, she’s a full warlock like Fjord, though probably a different aspect of Ukatoa like Great Old One or Celestial even, and she chose Tome Pact or Blade pact since she had a book/journal that sounds like a spellbook and she has magical dagger.
  • a Profane Soul Blood Hunter which is the caster subclass of the Blood Hunter and can utilize limited Warlock spellcasting
  • an Eldritch Knight Fighter
  • or and least likely an Arcane Trickster Rogue or a Bard.

Counterspell and dispel are available to those classes at varying levels at least according to PC creation rules. I state that because NPCs are crafted differently than PCs to ensure gameplay balance.

And Vera, well she’s able to cast locate object on the book so she might have some magical abilities. We don’t know a lot about Vera so her class theorizing is much broader than Avantika’s.

  • She might be a wizard or sorcerer. Though we don’t know her arcane tradition or sorcerous origins. I’m leaning toward Abjuration or Divination wizard since she seems to be protective of Avantika but her recent statements seem like there’s something not quite there any more.

blog.name: mollymauk-is-fine
blog.title: A Blog About Mollymauk Being Fine

summary:
“Mollymauk is fine,” I say into the mic.
The crowd boos. I begin to walk off in shame, when a voice speaks and commands silence...
body:
“Mollymauk is fine,” I say into the mic.

The crowd boos. I begin to walk off in shame, when a voice speaks and commands silence from the room.

“They’re right,” they say. I look for the owner of the voice. There in the 9th row stands: Mollymauk, because he is fine.

reblog.comment:

The crowd boos. I begin to walk off in shame, when a voice speaks and commands silence from the room.

“They’re right,” they say. I look for the owner of the voice. There in the 9th row stands: Mollymauk, because he is fine.

The crowd boos. I begin to walk off in shame, when a voice speaks and commands silence from the room.

“They’re right,” they say. I look for the owner of the voice. There in the 9th row stands: Mollymauk, because he is fine.

summary: Beauregard for the ask meme, or Jester if you've already gotten one for Beau
question: Beauregard for the ask meme, or Jester if you've already gotten one for Beau
answer:
I’ll do two for one since I have a prompt do Beau alone in my inbox already!

Jester:

somewhat attractive | eh | not really my type | cute as a button! | pretty | handsome | beautiful | stud | gorgeous | SWEET LORD MERCY

can you relate to this character on a personal level?: no | not really | somewhat | yes | they are me

would you date/be friends with this character in real life if they were real?: total bros | friends | best friends | date | become their steady boyfriend/ girlfriend | neither | i don’t know |

Beau:

somewhat attractive | eh | not really my type | pretty | handsome | beautiful | stud | gorgeous | SWEET LORD MERCY

can you relate to this character on a personal level?: no | not really | somewhat | yes | they are me

would you date/be friends with this character in real life if they were real?: total bros | friends | best friends | date | become their steady boyfriend/ girlfriend | neither | i don’t know |

title: let me pitch a concept
body: two characters…one tough, angry, trying to be softer. one sweet and silly but has sadness inside, grappling with the complicated nature of the world . both struggle with feeling abandoned and lonely, and find support and solace in each other. each is the first real friend the other has made…and the best part? theyre roommates babey. its beaujester

blog.name: mrandmrsvex
blog.title: Mr. and Mrs. Vex, to be fair
blog.description:
Critical role fanblog in general, major Perc'ahlia trash in particular.  basically I just have a lot of feelings for Vox Machina and I want to scream them all at you.

THINGS THAT ARE TOTALLY COOL TO DO:
- reblogging any of my posts, screenshots and writing
- adding commentary to anything, or your own headcanons, or whatever
- shooting me a message with any random thing you wanna tell me, questions, writing prompts, I love it all
(if I don't react to a reblog/added comment/tags then sorry! My tumblr is really broken and I often don't see it for days. I DO TRY TO READ ALL TAGS ON REBLOGS OF MY POSTS THOUGH cause I love them. a lot.)

summary: Drawing critical role stuff is fun bc I actually have a solid design for those characters but i have to either draw Molly or...
body:
Drawing critical role stuff is fun bc I actually have a solid design for those characters but i have to either draw Molly or leave them as busts bc I can’t draw anyone else’s clothes

Taz is the opposite bc I can draw all their outfits but I only actually have a design for kravitz

blog.name: whalohs
blog.title: wander, wonder.
blog.description: ( j. she/her. i spend all my time overanalyzing critical role. )

summary: shoutouts to that one anon that hit me up when i was ready to let sleep take me, this one’s for you. that’s right, it’s time to...
body:
shoutouts to that one anon that hit me up when i was ready to let sleep take me, this one’s for you. that’s right, it’s time to talk about the ( mental ) state of caleb™. 

a million words and thus under a cut. shoot me an ask if you want me to talk about anything, but please keep it respectful!

  • real quick disclaimer: i think he’s a terrible person. i don’t think he’s someone who will “get better” with the power of friendship. i love him dearly but i recognize a very real possibility he’ll just slip further and further into darker places. i don’t think he’s a team player for altruistic reasons. and i love all of this about him.
  • that said oh god where do i even begin – i guess with his self loathing?
    • because this is some serious, serious stuff you guys. i still think about his broken laugh when nott and beau tried to console him like 20+ episodes ago. liam’s talked about it a lot in talks, how caleb thinks he’s a garbage person and he only deserves to be treated poorly, and despite the people he’s surrounded himself with i don’t think he thinks any better of himself now.
    • that said it’s also ridiculous to expect that it’d be any better? he wants to be thought of as a terrible human being. a true scum of the earth. that’s the only way he thinks he’d be able to atone.
      • honestly? this is largely why i’m terrified of someone like jester finding out. not because she’d react poorly, but because he will. he’s convinced he doesn’t deserve jester’s kindness or her friendship. like i said, she’s more or less everything he wanted and everything he failed on. being around jester is like trying to stare at the sun literally all the time for him, and i don’t mean that in a good way
      • but he’s doing it because that’s what caleb does. constantly punishing himself because he thinks he deserves it. like y'all.
    • he’s thought this way for 30+ years of his life, even if he wasn’t entirely “himself” for a lot of those years. he’s absolutely the victim in this scenario, but no one has told him that. so he’s going to continue to believe it until something really big comes along to convince him otherwise.
      • i say no one because he won’t count anyone. not beau, not nott, not anyone. he cares about nott and thinks beau’s great, but they weren’t around when caleb studied under ikithon. he cannot believe their words because to him? they don’t know everything. they don’t know how awful he really was.
      • he’ll make every excuse to void every opinion. his parents ( they’re his parents, even if he doesn’t deserve them ), eodwulf and astrid ( still not close enough ), or ikithon ( lmao as if ikithon would say it ), the rest of the nein. i really don’t want to downplay how much caleb hates himself, because god it’s intense.
    • here’s the thing: caleb’s self-loathing is out of this world, but he’s still incredibly sure of himself. he knows he’s smart, knows his strengths, and will absolutely use all of them. he hates the man that ikithon molded himself to be, but that won’t stop him from using all the tactics he learned then.
      • guys i joke about the infamous “buuuuuuut” a lot with my friends but the context behind it is horrifiying?? this man is not above torture to get whatever he needs.
    • it’s largely why it’s really, really difficult to shake him out of his self-loathing. because he’s smart, because he’s extremely … confident? in his smarts and abilities. because he knows that he is an awful person ( regardless of whether that’s objectively true ), and no one else can shake him from his belief.
      • it’s why i like him so much, tbh; he’s very, very stubborn, but in ways that you don’t really expect.
  • god okay this seems out of the blue but hear me out, because liam’s playing a D&D faux-pas in a really amazing way?? he’s playing a character who doesn’t want to be in a party. i’m convinced liam o'brien sits at home figuring out the best way to subvert tropes and puts them into his characters.
    • if caleb could do everything he thinks he needs to do, he wouldn’t have nott by his side. he wouldn’t be with the mighty nein. he’d fuck off and then mess with the very fabric of time however he’d like!! but he knows he is one hobo dude possibly wanted by a very powerful, very evil wizard. he won’t get anywhere without at least some people beside him.
      • he doesn’t want to be in this party. he doesn’t want to make connections with these people. if he could, he’d leave in a heartbeat – but the reason he can’t leave isn’t necessarily because he’s attached to them; though that is a part of it. it’s because he knows he’s stronger with them. and he needs to be stronger.
    • so what does this have anything to do with caleb’s mental state?
    • caleb is not the emotional glue holding this party together. that implies he’s allowing himself to get attached to people. he’s not jester or nott ( or even beau! ) who can do that naturally; he needs to expend energy to do it. except he’s so busy convincing himself he shouldn’t be forming deep relationships that he doesn’t have the capacity to accept that from other people, let alone extend that kind of emotional support to his friends.
      • but boy, does he need the people. not emotionally, but practically. and if we know anything about caleb, it’s that he’s ambitious enough to do whatever needs to be done to achieve his goals. so … that’s what he’s doing.
        • he buys drinks for people very often. in fact, he spends almost all his money (that hasn’t gone to ink & paper) on other people he needs to befriend. he sits down to speak to people who seem to be going through any kind of conflict in an attempt to keep them here ( jester, when they fought over money. fjord, after scroll gate. beau, after bowl gate. caduceus when he looked like he wanted to leave. ). he’s always complimenting the people around him ( jester and caduceus are the best clerics, fjord is the face of the group, nott is extremely intelligent and fast, beau and yasha are the strongest, etc. )
        • he’s doing all of this to keep these people close to him. i wouldn’t say he’s manipulating them, because to some degree, he does care about them now! and this isn’t necessarily done with malicious intent. but to say that all these things are done out of altruism or compassion would be wrong. if there was a very, very good reason for him to leave this group of people, he would do it.
    • the point i’m trying to make is that caleb still puts himself and his goals before the rest of the mighty nein – as of now, he doesn’t have the mental capacity to even think of that. which, typically, is found in character who don’t want to be in a party; but liam has molded caleb’s circumstances in a way where he needs this party to achieve his goals. so he’s sticking around. and i think that’s absolutely brilliant. i’m terrified of what’s going to happen next, but i’m 10000% here for the ride.

i wanted to add more but this is already 1200 words, i’m going to exercise something called self-restraint for once ( 1200 words… later….. look i never claimed to be perfect ).
body_abstract:
shoutouts to that one anon that hit me up when i was ready to let sleep take me, this one’s for you. that’s right, it’s time to talk about the ( mental ) state of caleb™. 

a million words and thus under a cut. shoot me an ask if you want me to talk about anything, but please keep it respectful!

reblog.comment:
shoutouts to that one anon that hit me up when i was ready to let sleep take me, this one’s for you. that’s right, it’s time to talk about the ( mental ) state of caleb™. 

a million words and thus under a cut. shoot me an ask if you want me to talk about anything, but please keep it respectful!

[[MORE]]

  • real quick disclaimer: i think he’s a terrible person. i don’t think he’s someone who will “get better” with the power of friendship. i love him dearly but i recognize a very real possibility he’ll just slip further and further into darker places. i don’t think he’s a team player for altruistic reasons. and i love all of this about him.
  • that said oh god where do i even begin – i guess with his self loathing?
    • because this is some serious, serious stuff you guys. i still think about his broken laugh when nott and beau tried to console him like 20+ episodes ago. liam’s talked about it a lot in talks, how caleb thinks he’s a garbage person and he only deserves to be treated poorly, and despite the people he’s surrounded himself with i don’t think he thinks any better of himself now.
    • that said it’s also ridiculous to expect that it’d be any better? he wants to be thought of as a terrible human being. a true scum of the earth. that’s the only way he thinks he’d be able to atone.
      • honestly? this is largely why i’m terrified of someone like jester finding out. not because she’d react poorly, but because he will. he’s convinced he doesn’t deserve jester’s kindness or her friendship. like i said, she’s more or less everything he wanted and everything he failed on. being around jester is like trying to stare at the sun literally all the time for him, and i don’t mean that in a good way
      • but he’s doing it because that’s what caleb does. constantly punishing himself because he thinks he deserves it. like y'all.
    • he’s thought this way for 30+ years of his life, even if he wasn’t entirely “himself” for a lot of those years. he’s absolutely the victim in this scenario, but no one has told him that. so he’s going to continue to believe it until something really big comes along to convince him otherwise.
      • i say no one because he won’t count anyone. not beau, not nott, not anyone. he cares about nott and thinks beau’s great, but they weren’t around when caleb studied under ikithon. he cannot believe their words because to him? they don’t know everything. they don’t know how awful he really was.
      • he’ll make every excuse to void every opinion. his parents ( they’re his parents, even if he doesn’t deserve them ), eodwulf and astrid ( still not close enough ), or ikithon ( lmao as if ikithon would say it ), the rest of the nein. i really don’t want to downplay how much caleb hates himself, because god it’s intense.
    • here’s the thing: caleb’s self-loathing is out of this world, but he’s still incredibly sure of himself. he knows he’s smart, knows his strengths, and will absolutely use all of them. he hates the man that ikithon molded himself to be, but that won’t stop him from using all the tactics he learned then.
      • guys i joke about the infamous “buuuuuuut” a lot with my friends but the context behind it is horrifiying?? this man is not above torture to get whatever he needs.
    • it’s largely why it’s really, really difficult to shake him out of his self-loathing. because he’s smart, because he’s extremely … confident? in his smarts and abilities. because he knows that he is an awful person ( regardless of whether that’s objectively true ), and no one else can shake him from his belief.
      • it’s why i like him so much, tbh; he’s very, very stubborn, but in ways that you don’t really expect.
  • god okay this seems out of the blue but hear me out, because liam’s playing a D&D faux-pas in a really amazing way?? he’s playing a character who doesn’t want to be in a party. i’m convinced liam o'brien sits at home figuring out the best way to subvert tropes and puts them into his characters.
    • if caleb could do everything he thinks he needs to do, he wouldn’t have nott by his side. he wouldn’t be with the mighty nein. he’d fuck off and then mess with the very fabric of time however he’d like!! but he knows he is one hobo dude possibly wanted by a very powerful, very evil wizard. he won’t get anywhere without at least some people beside him.
      • he doesn’t want to be in this party. he doesn’t want to make connections with these people. if he could, he’d leave in a heartbeat – but the reason he can’t leave isn’t necessarily because he’s attached to them; though that is a part of it. it’s because he knows he’s stronger with them. and he needs to be stronger.
    • so what does this have anything to do with caleb’s mental state?
    • caleb is not the emotional glue holding this party together. that implies he’s allowing himself to get attached to people. he’s not jester or nott ( or even beau! ) who can do that naturally; he needs to expend energy to do it. except he’s so busy convincing himself he shouldn’t be forming deep relationships that he doesn’t have the capacity to accept that from other people, let alone extend that kind of emotional support to his friends.
      • but boy, does he need the people. not emotionally, but practically. and if we know anything about caleb, it’s that he’s ambitious enough to do whatever needs to be done to achieve his goals. so … that’s what he’s doing.
        • he buys drinks for people very often. in fact, he spends almost all his money (that hasn’t gone to ink & paper) on other people he needs to befriend. he sits down to speak to people who seem to be going through any kind of conflict in an attempt to keep them here ( jester, when they fought over money. fjord, after scroll gate. beau, after bowl gate. caduceus when he looked like he wanted to leave. ). he’s always complimenting the people around him ( jester and caduceus are the best clerics, fjord is the face of the group, nott is extremely intelligent and fast, beau and yasha are the strongest, etc. )
        • he’s doing all of this to keep these people close to him. i wouldn’t say he’s manipulating them, because to some degree, he does care about them now! and this isn’t necessarily done with malicious intent. but to say that all these things are done out of altruism or compassion would be wrong. if there was a very, very good reason for him to leave this group of people, he would do it.
    • the point i’m trying to make is that caleb still puts himself and his goals before the rest of the mighty nein – as of now, he doesn’t have the mental capacity to even think of that. which, typically, is found in character who don’t want to be in a party; but liam has molded caleb’s circumstances in a way where he needs this party to achieve his goals. so he’s sticking around. and i think that’s absolutely brilliant. i’m terrified of what’s going to happen next, but i’m 10000% here for the ride.

i wanted to add more but this is already 1200 words, i’m going to exercise something called self-restraint for once ( 1200 words… later….. look i never claimed to be perfect ).
